Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Bovine beta-casein(114-119) (natural AMPs; cattle, ruminant, mammals, animals, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: boine milk digestion by bacteria,Bos taurus

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 37.5% similarity toLacrain. GRAVY -0.17; Mol Wt  750.851; Mol ex. coeff 1490. A fragment of bovine beta-casein generated by two proteases of Bacillus cereus RC6, presuambly to gain a niche advantage over other competitive species.Activity: inhibition zone: Active against B. thuringiensis USDA HD22 (<30 mm), B. cereus ATCC 11778 BC45 (<30 mm), and L. monocytogenes (<10 mm). Updated 6/2018; 7/2021.
Literature Information.Author: Ouertani A, Chaabouni I, Mosbah A, Long J, Barakat M, Mansuelle P, Mghirbi O, Najjari A, Ouzari HI, Masmoudi AS, Maresca M, Ortet P, Gigmes D, Mabrouk K, Cherif A.2018
Literature Information.Title: Two New Secreted Proteases Generate a Casein-Derived Antimicrobial Peptide in Bacillus cereus Food Born Isolate Leading to Bacterial Competition in Milk.
